For a thrilling and action-packed movie, recommend "Zero Dark Thirty". It chronicles the decade-long hunt for al-Qaeda terrorist leader Osama bin Laden and his death at the hands of the Navy S.E.A.L.s Team 6.

If you prefer a more dystopian and unsettling film, check out "Red Dawn". It's a claustrophobic experience about a Mexican middle class family caught in the atrocities of wild and heartless army forces during the 1968's Olimpic games.

If you're looking for something more light-hearted but still engaging, "Gladiator" is a great choice. It's a story of a gladiator training camp and the brutal world of underground boxing.
